types.name: A-sexual
types.definition: A person who does not experience sexual attraction to others.

types.name: A-romantic
types.definition: A person who does not experience romantic attraction to others.

types.name: A-gender
types.definition: A person who identifies as neither male nor female, or as neutral in terms of gender.

types.name: sexual
types.definition: A person who does not adhere to traditional gender roles and may have a mix of masculine and feminine characteristics.

types.name: romantic
types.definition: A person who does not adhere to traditional romantic roles based on gender.

types.name: gender
types.definition: A person whose gender identity is a blend of male and female characteristics, or is indeterminate.

types.name: Bi-sexual
types.definition: A person who experiences sexual attraction to others without regard to gender, or to multiple genders.

types.name: Bi-romantic
types.definition: A person who experiences romantic attraction to others without regard to gender, or to multiple genders.

types.name: Bi-gender
types.definition: A person who identifies as having two distinct gender identities, either simultaneously or alternately.

types.name: Demi-sexual
types.definition: A person who experiences sexual attraction only after forming a deep emotional bond with someone.

types.name: Demi-romantic
types.definition: A person who experiences romantic attraction only after forming a deep emotional bond with someone.

types.name: sexual
types.definition: A person who is primarily attracted to people of the same gender.

types.name: romantic
types.definition: A person who is primarily romantically attracted to people of the same gender.

types.name: Gender-fluid
types.definition: A person whose gender identity fluctuates or varies over time. They may identify with different genders at different times or in different circumstances.

types.name: Gender-queer
types.definition: A person whose gender identity is outside the traditional binary classification of male or female. They may identify with a gender that is neither exclusively male nor female, a combination of both, or a different gender altogether.

types.name: sexual
types.definition: A woman who is primarily attracted to other women.

types.name: romantic
types.definition: A woman who is primarily romantically attracted to other women.

types.name: gender
types.definition: A person whose gender identity is not exclusively male or female. They may identify as both, neither, a mix of both, or as a different gender altogether.

types.name: Pan-sexual
types.definition: A person who is attracted to people of all gender identities.

types.name: Pan-romantic
types.definition: A person who is romantically attracted to people of all gender identities.

types.name: Pan-gender
types.definition: A person who may identify with any gender or no gender.

types.name: Poly-sexual
types.definition: A person who is attracted to multiple genders, but not necessarily all genders.

types.name: Poly-romantic
types.definition: A person who is romantically attracted to multiple genders, but not necessarily all genders.

types.name: Poly-gender
types.definition: A person who may identify with multiple genders.

types.name: sexual
types.definition: A term used by some individuals to describe their sexual orientation or gender identity in a way that does not conform to societal norms.

types.name: romantic
types.definition: A term used by some individuals to describe their romantic orientation in a way that does not conform to societal norms.

types.name: gender
types.definition: A term used by some individuals to describe their gender identity in a way that does not conform to societal norms.

types.name: Trans-sexual
types.definition: A person who has undergone medical treatments to change their physical sex characteristics to align with their gender identity.

types.name: Trans-gender
types.definition: A person whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

types.name: gender
types.definition: A term used by some Indigenous North American cultures to describe a person who embodies both masculine and feminine qualities, often possessing a spiritual role.
